svrl:successful-report.test: if ($file='octet-stream') then () else if ($file = 'msword') then not(matches(@xlink:href,'\.doc[x]?$')) else if ($file = 'excel') then not(matches(@xlink:href,'\.xl[s|t|m][x|m|b]?$')) else if ($file='x-m') then not(matches(@xlink:href,'\.m$')) else if ($file='tab-separated-values') then not(matches(@xlink:href,'\.tsv$')) else if ($file='jpeg') then not(matches(@xlink:href,'\.[Jj][Pp][Gg]$')) else if ($file='postscript') then not(matches(@xlink:href,'\.[Aa][Ii]$|\.[Pp][Ss]$')) else if ($file='x-tex') then not(matches(@xlink:href,'\.tex$')) else if ($file='x-gzip') then not(matches(@xlink:href,'\.gz$')) else if ($file='html') then not(matches(@xlink:href,'\.html$')) else if (@mimetype='text') then not(matches(@xlink:href,'\.txt$|\.py$|\.xml$|\.sh$|\.rtf$|\.c$')) else not(ends-with(@xlink:href,concat('.',$file)))
svrl:successful-report.svrl:text: media must have a file reference in @xlink:href which is equivalent to its @mime-subtype.
